statement: How many minutes is it from 23:35 today to 01:15 tomorrow?
Which of these is equal to $(0.1+0.2+0.3-0.4) \div 0.5$?
Sam has eaten three-quarters of the grapes. What is the ratio of the number of grapes that remain to the number Sam has eaten?
Which of the following five shapes can be cut into four pieces by a single straight cut?
On Aoife's 16th birthday, Buster was three times her age. On Aoife's 21st birthday, how old was Buster?
Which of these is closest to 7?
The shortest street is 2.06 m and the Trans-Canada Highway is about 7821 km long. Approximately how many times longer than the street is the highway?
The diagram shows a kite PGRF inside rhombus PQRS with \nangle PGQ = 35^{\circ}, angle PFS = 35^{\circ}, angle PQG = 120^{\circ} and angle PSF = 120^{\circ}.\nWhat is the size of angle FPG?
What is 50% of 18.3 plus 18.3% of 50?
What is the last digit of the smallest positive integer whose digits add to 2019?

Two players X and Y take alternate turns filling circles with 1,2 or 3 so no adjacent vertices share the same number. In each of the five diagrams it is Y's turn.\nIn which diagrams can Y move to ensure X loses?
Jamal writes a sequence of six integers where after the first three terms each term is the sum of the three previous terms. His sequence is --, --, --, 8, 13, 25. What is his first term?
In how many different ways can you spell out JMC, starting at the centre and moving to a neighbouring square each time (horizontally, vertically or diagonally)?
Each edge in the diagram has length 1 cm. What is the length of the longest path along edges starting at a vertex and not revisiting any vertex?

Four L-shapes are to be placed in the 4×4 grid to cover all cells (no overlap). Each piece can be rotated/reflected and the black dot is visible both sides. How many of the 16 cells could contain the black dot?
Tamsin writes three two-digit integers using digits 3,4,5,6,7,8 exactly once. One number is square, one is prime and one is triangular. Which prime does she write?
A rectangle is three times as long as it is high. The area of a square is twelve times the area of the rectangle. What is the ratio of the perimeter of the square to the perimeter of the rectangle?
What fraction of the integers from 1 to 8000 inclusive are perfect cubes?
Each row, each column and each bold 2×3 rectangle contains the numbers 1 to 6. What number should go in the cell marked x?

Emily writes the largest two-digit prime whose digits are both prime. Krish writes the smallest two-digit prime whose digits are both prime. Kirsten subtracts Krish's number from Emily's. What is the result?
The diagram shows a regular hexagon PQRSTU, a square PQVW and an equilateral triangle VXW. What is the size of angle XVR?

In the multiplication shown, T, R, A and P are all different digits:

T R A P 
	imes 9 
P A R T

What is the value of R?
Two squares JKLM and PQRS are shown. JK = 6 cm, PQ = 4 cm, and K is the midpoint of RS. What is the area of the shaded region?
The diagram shows a regular heptagon with labelled angles p,q,r,s,t. Which expression equals p+q+r+s+t?
The first fifteen positive integers are arranged in a triangle. They are to be rearranged so the five integers along each edge have the same sum. When done, what is the greatest possible such sum?
